title: Biggest early-season enigmas in our latest Bubble Watch
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and question marks around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Travis Hunter effect is alive in the 2025 college football season
content: There won't be another player like Hunter. But his play has inspired other teams to look for two-way stars.

title: Giddey agrees to 4-year, $100M deal with Bulls
content: Restricted free agent Josh Giddey has reached agreement on a four-year, $100 million contract to re-sign with the Chicago Bulls.

title: Buckeyes' Day no fan of proposed portal changes
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day is not a fan of proposed changes to the NCAA transfer portal, saying the potential move to a single transfer window in January "doesn't make any sense."

title: Dolphins star Hill accused of domestic violence
content: Tyreek Hill's estranged wife has alleged in court filings that he committed domestic violence, which the Dolphins receiver has vehemently denied.

title: Family has Franco admitted to mental health clinic
content: Suspended Rays shortstop Wander Franco was detained by police on request of his family and admitted into a clinic in the Dominican Republic for mental health issues.

title: Steelers to sign Peppers in wake of Elliott injury
content: The Pittsburgh Steelers are planning to sign veteran safety Jabrill Peppers, coach Mike Tomlin said Tuesday, after starting safety DeShon Elliott left Sunday's season opener against the Jets with a knee injury.

title: Kane among those thrilled to see return of Toews
content: Like so many around the NHL, Red Wings forward Patrick Kane, who won three Stanley Cup championships with the Blackhawks playing alongside Jonathan Toews, is eager to see the return of his former running mate, who signed with the Jets this offseason.

title: Big 12 penalizes officiating crew over rules gaffe
content: The Big 12 has removed an officiating crew from a Week 3 assignment after the group committed a rules violation during Missouri's win over Kansas, the conference announced on Tuesday.

title: ✍ NFL trade grades: Who won Bigsby deal?
content: The Eagles added some running back depth behind Saquon Barkley, but did they give up too much for Bigsby? We sized up the deal from both sides.

title: Week 1 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 1's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Solak's weekly NFL thoughts and lessons: The five best QB debuts of Week 1, plus what the Giants should do
content: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain their great Week 1 play? Ben Solak stacks the top QB newcomers -- and begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

title: Top 50 USMNT players, ranked by club form: Which players has Pochettino missed?

title: MLB most exciting player bracket: Featuring the most electrifying star on all 30 teams
content: Witt or Judge? Ohtani or De La Cruz? We narrow the field -- with a rep from every team -- to one true must-watch player.

title: The John Cena eras: From Ruthless Aggression to 17-time WWE champ
content: We highlight the key moments from Cena's remarkable 23-year career before he retires the jorts in December.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: A new No. 1 -- and highlights for every team in final edition
content: The hottest team and the top team aren't the always same. See our final 1-13 as the regular season wraps.

title: Ranking first-year WNBA coaches who have beaten -- or fallen short of -- expectations
content: Natalie Nakase has the Valkyries playoff-bound. Here's how all seven first-time WNBA head coaches have done.

title: New faces, new places: Ranking the top 14 newcomers for the 2025-26 NBA season
content: Coach Mike Brown, Kevin Durant, Myles Turner and others are ranked by who will be the most impactful on their new teams.

title: Excerpt: The forgotten legend of Notre Dame coach Frank Leahy
content: He won the most national titles of any Notre Dame football coach, but Frank Leahy's achievements in South Bend have been underappreciated.

title: Projected 2026 NFL draft order: Could another No. 1 pick join Cam Ward in Tennessee?
content: ESPN's Football Power Index projects the 2026 NFL draft order for Round 1. Which teams have the best odds to pick early?

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes from Kiper, Miller and Reid
content: John Mateer rising? Questions around LaNorris Sellers and Cade Klubnik? Updates on NFL draft prospects.

title: Bills' big comeback: Long live-betting odds and shift in MVP, Super Bowl futures
content: The fourth quarter of the Bills-Ravens had it all -- including bettors putting down huge amounts on high odds.

title: Should you bet on Mateer or Moore to win the Heisman?
content: As odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: Explaining USWNT star Alyssa Thompson's move from Angel City to Chelsea
content: Alyssa Thompson's high-priced move has implications for the USWNT, NWSL, Chelsea, Angel City and the player herself. Let's break it all down.

title: Can anyone stop Lamine Yamal and Spain marching to World Cup glory?
content: Spain's 6-0 win in Turkey was an exquisite recital of sublime football that has Lamine Yamal, Pedri & Co. looking like World Cup winners in waiting. Can they be stopped?

title: With nine months until World Cup, does Pochettino know his best USMNT XI?
content: If Pochettino doesn't know his USMNT XI, is he willing to commit to one soon before he runs out of time ahead of the World Cup?

title: The strangely specific transfer obsessions of elite clubs, and what the summer window taught us about them
content: Every team has preferences when it comes to transfers ... but some are more surprising than others. What did we learn this summer about Real Madrid's, Arsenal's and other elite clubs' fixations?

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG prepare new deal for Barcola as Liverpool, Bayern circle
content: Bradley Barcola is wanted by Liverpool and Bayern Munich, and PSG plan to offer the winger a new deal.

title: NFL Week 1's top performance? Check the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award leaderboard
content: Fans weighed in on Week 1's top players, casting their votes for the 'Himmy' Award between Josh Allen, Aaron Rodgers, Emeka Egbuka and Daniel Jones.

title: Canelo vs. Crawford: History of boxers moving up in weight
content: Terence Crawford is not the first fighter to move up multiple divisions for better challenges. How did the other boxers do?

title: All you need to know about Saturday's fight
content: Andreas Hale explains why Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford are fighting, what it means for boxing and more.

title: Real or not? 14 contenders, 14 reasons they can -- or can't? -- win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: Three young arms are here to carry the Mets into October
content: The rookie trio of Nolan McLean, Jonah Tong and Brandon Sproat looks to lift New York's fortunes this season.

title: Fantasy hockey defense tiers: The elite, the roster fillers and everyone in between
content: Make your fantasy hockey draft strategy easier with detailed defensemen tiers and a guide to the position.

title: Forward tier list: From must-haves to lottery tickets
content: Make your fantasy hockey draft strategy easier with detailed forward tiers and a guide to the position.

title: Centre seeks ‘factual report’ on forest rights complaint concerning Nicobar project
content: Tribal Affairs Ministry has written to the Chief Secretary of Andaman and Nicobar Islands seeking report on a complaint that the administration falsely certified completing identification and settlement of forest rights

title: Hubbub around Habba
content: The Congress government’s decision to invite Booker winner Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Mysuru Dasara has the BJP up in arms, calling it ‘appeasement politics’

title: Rajasthan Assembly passes ‘anti-conversion’ Bill with steep penalties
content: It contains the provisions for life imprisonment and fines up to ₹1 crore; will help in maintaining ‘peace and harmony’ in the society, says MoS (Home); Cong. boycotts debate, stages a walkout

title: Karnataka set to get investment of ₹1,000 crore in bioenergy sector as KSBDB inks pact with German agency
content: Karnataka’s bioenergy sector is set to get a boost with Hamburg Invest, a financial institution of Germany, signing a Letter of Intent with the Karnataka State Bioenergy Development Board to facilitate investment of ₹1,000 crore in bioenergy-related projects

title: Victory of nationalist ideology, says Radhakrishnan on win
content: The Vice-President-elect said that in a democracy, “both the ruling party and Opposition parties are important”. “It is like two sides of the same coin,” he said

title: SPCA lacks teeth, needs enforcement powers to rein in errant cops
content: Though it has been constituted under  Section 110 of the Kerala Police Act for examining complaints against police officers of and up to the said rank of Deputy Superintendent of Police, it lacks enforcement measures. Chairman says without such powers, SPCA can only recommend action

title: State govt. to combat malnutrition among children through Chiguru scheme
content: Minister Hebbalkar launches the scheme for the select districts of Ballari, Bidar, Kalaburagi, Yadgir, Belagavi, Raichur, Chitradurga, Vijayanagara

title: HESCOM asked to explore uninterrupted power supply for 24x7 water supply network
content: This comes in a bid to address the issue of unscheduled load shedding affecting the 24x7 water supply system in Hubballi-Dharwad

title:
Sengottaiyan meets Amit Shah, Nirmala 
Sitharaman in New Delhi
content: Some AIADMK seniors express discomfort with his action. But they are guarded in saying whether disciplinary action will be taken against him

title: Congratulatory messages pour in for Vice-President elect C.P. Radhakrishnan
content: President Droupadi Murmu says, “his decades of rich experience in public life will contribute significantly to the country’s progress”; “His life has always been devoted to serving society and empowering the poor,” says PM Modi

title: Colourful pageantry marks end of Onam celebrations
content: The floats on display highlight contemporary issues as well as extoll the achievements made by the State

title: Day after SC order, Election Commission directs Bihar CEO to accept Aadhaar as 12th document in voter roll revision
content: The communique from the poll panel also noted that under the Representation of People Act, 1950, Aadhaar is already one of the documents listed for the purpose of establishing the identity of a person

title: Opposition gathers flock, but fails to stand united in V-P polls
content: NDA gets 13 votes more than its strength in two Houses, suggesting crossvoting; Opposition claims that out of 315 votes it expected, 300 were cast for its candidate, while 15 votes were invalidated

title: Assam doctor asked to explain 21 C-sections in 10 hours
content: Senior gynaecologist Kantheswar Bordoloi said a single caesarean takes 15-25 minutes, depending on the degree of complication

title: Actor Karisma Kapoor’s children move Delhi HC for share in late father’s property
content: The plaintiff submits that the purported will allegedly executed by their father ‘is not a legal and valid document, is forged and fabricated and in any event surrounded by suspicious circumstances’

title: "Nationalistic Ideology" Overall Winner: Veep-Elect's Jibe At Opposition
content: Vice President elect CP Radhakrishnan said this evening that the elections for the post conducted earlier today made it clear that "nationalistic ideology" is the overall winner.

title: Hamas Says Its Leadership Survived Israeli Strike On Qatar
content: Israel launched a strike targeting Hamas' leadership in Qatar on Tuesday, officials said, further widening its campaign against the militant group.

title: Trump Does Not Support Israel's Attack On Qatar: White House
content: The White House distanced itself Tuesday from Israel's strikes against Hamas in Doha, reiterating President Donald Trump's support for ally Qatar, while declining to confirm if Israel had pre-notified Washington of its attack.

title: "Peace Can't Be Built On Appeasement": Meitei, Thadou Groups Raise Concerns Over Deal With Kuki Insurgents
content: The killing of a Thadou tribe leader, Kuki insurgents stopping a bus this week to check whether any passenger had taken a video of their camp in Manipur, and no clarity on free movement on highways have sparked fresh calls again the SoO agreement.

title: Vice President Election Highlights: PM Modi, Amit Shah Congratulate New Vice President
content: Vice Presidential Election 2025 Highlights: Parliamentarians will choose between NDA's CP Radhakrishnan and the Opposition's B Sudershan Reddy for the post of Vice President today.

title: Mercedes-Benz To Continue Investing In 'Priority Market' India: Co-Executive
content: Mercedes-Benz will continue investing in the 'priority market' India, without putting on hold any of its plans, including to bolster local production, in the wake of impending EU-India free trade agreement, according to a top company executive.

title: Infant, Elder Sister Die Of Snakebite As Black Magician Fails To Cure Them
content: A nine-month-old baby and his elder sister died of snakebite after their parents took them to a black magician who failed to cure them in Odisha's Nabarangpur district, an official said on Tuesday.

title: Caught Taking Bribe, Delhi Cop Throws Money Into Air; Arrested
content: An assistant sub-inspector of Delhi Police was arrested by the vigilance unit on Tuesday while accepting a bribe of Rs 15,000, an official said.

title: Probe Agency Attaches Fresh Assets Worth Rs 186 Crore Against DHFL In Bank Fraud Case
content: Fresh assets worth about Rs 186 crore have been attached under the anti-money laundering law in an alleged bank loan fraud case against the Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Ltd (DHFL) and its promoters, the ED said on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Gears Up for Winter Smog With 17-Point Action Plan
content: With Delhi's dreaded smog season just weeks away, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Tuesday reviewed the city's 17-point Winter 2025 Air Pollution Control Action Plan, directing departments to complete preparations by October.

title: Gold Worth Rs 800-Crore Smuggled Into India From China Border Over 2 Years: Probe Agency
content: An ED investigation into a gold-smuggling racket being operated across the India-China LAC has found that more than 1,000 kg of the yellow metal worth Rs 800 crore was illegally brought to India with the alleged involvement of a Chinese

title: 8,000% Spike In VPN Sign-Ups In Nepal After Social Media Ban
content: Nepal's sudden social media blackout triggered an unprecedented rush for virtual private networks (VPN), with sign-ups from the country skyrocketing 6,000 per cent in three days.

title: Karnataka Congress MLA, Family Bought Foreign Travel Tickets Using Betting Funds: Probe Agency
content: Arrested Karnataka Congress MLA K C Veerendra, his family members and associates booked international travel tickets worth crores of rupees

title: Macron Appoints Defence Minister Lecornu As France's Latest Prime Minister
content: French President Macron late Tuesday appointed Defense Minister Sebastien Lecornu as France's new prime minister, the country's fourth in about a year.

title: PM Modi Announces Rs 1,600 Crore Aid For Flood-Ravaged Punjab
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced a financial assistance of Rs 1,600 crore for flood-hit Punjab as he reviewed the situation and damage in the state, which was battling its worst deluge since 1988.

title: Assam's New Rule To Bypass Tribunal, Empower Cops To Expel Illegal Immigrants
content: The Assam cabinet has approved the framing of an SOP under the Immigrants (Expulsion from Assam) Act, 1950, to guide the District Commissioners and senior police officers to expel illegal migrants from the state.

title: Who Is Sudan Gurung, The Face Of Gen Z Protests In Nepal
content: Sudan Gurung and Hami Nepal earlier called for peaceful protests across the country to stand against the government's decision to ban social media last week.

title: Donald Trump Is Not The Only US President In Jeffrey Epstein's Birthday Book
content: An entry attributed to former President Bill Clinton is among some 50 greetings that appear in a 50th birthday book compiled for Epstein in 2003, years before the disgraced New York financier faced charges related to sexual exploitation of girls.

title: 7 Forest Officials Locked Up In Tiger Cage By Angry Karnataka Villagers
content: A group of people were seen standing around a huge cage in a forest area in Karnataka. But inside the cage was not a big cat but nearly half a dozen men. The men in the cage were the staff of the forest department.

title: US Ready To Take 'Strong' Action On Russia Over Ukraine: Treasury Chief
content: The United States is willing to take firm action on Russia over Ukraine, but Europe's full cooperation is crucial, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said after talks with the EU sanctions envoy Monday.

title: Army Chief stresses the need for technological edge to stay ahead of rivals
content: The goalposts will keep changing. Because it is not only me, it is the adversary that is also enhancing his technology. I need to make sure my technological level is ready to beat its impact

title: C.P. Radhakrishnan: affable organisation man who doesn’t play political games
content: Untainted by corruption and having remained above petty organisational politics, Mr. Radhakrishnan is seen as someone who can steer the Rajya Sabha with a similar reach across both sides of the aisle.

title: Horatti writes to Speaker expressing displeasure over him taking ‘unilateral decisions’
content: Council Chairman unhappy over drawing up of the official travel plan to Barbados where Commonwealth conference is getting under way in October; says Assembly and Council are two faces of the same coin.

title: Scores of Keralites stranded in Nepal
content: MEA told to take necessary steps to ensure the safety of the Malayalis stranded in Kathmandu: Union Minister

title: After let up in rains, State registers sharp rise in energy use
content: The Southern Discom has availed 203.38 MU energy with the peak load clocked at 10,450 MW, the highest ever during the monsoon season

title: India hosts global audit leaders to promote tech-driven good governance
content: The event with participation from over 29 countries focuses on how emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), data analytics and geospatial tools can improve public audit systems and citizen-focused transparent governance

title: GST tweaks: paper merchants flag anomalies, elevator makers seek lowering of levy for households
content: A major concern is the anomalous GST treatment given to notebooks, textbooks and the paper used in their production, paper traders pointed out

title: Mamata urges people on border with Nepal to keep the peace
content: The Trinamool Congress chairperson stressed that foreign policy is the domain of the central government. The CM had taken a similar stand when Sheikh Hasina’s regime fell in Bangladesh

title: Manipur Naga body imposes ‘trade embargo’ to protest border fencing
content: The United Naga Council said it is the first step in non-cooperation with the government to protest the move to fence the India-Myanmar border

title: Telangana Minister woos TN apparel makers, says Textile Policy on cards
content: He invited Tiruppur industry leaders to participate in a forthcoming roundtable conference to be chaired by Minister for Agriculture and Textiles Tummala Nageswara Rao

title: Three soldiers killed as avalanche hits Army base camp in Siachen
content: The avalanche hit the camp located at an altitude of around 12,000 feet, trapping the soldiers under snow. Two of the deceased were Agniveers

title: TTD honours vegetable donors
content: Additional Executive Officer calls for dynamic mapping to streamline supplies and prevent duplication

title: Organised attempt afoot to manipulate electoral rolls in closely contested seats, alleges B.R. Patil
content: Covert teams are hired to profile voter preferences and try to get those voters favouring their opponent deleted from the electoral rolls without their consent or knowledge, says the Congress legislator

title: Necklace theft case: Crime Branch confirms false charge against Dalit woman by Peroorkada police
content: The police allegedly fabricated a story claiming the ornament had been retrieved, while continuing to portray Ms. Bindhu as the culprit, Crime Branch findings say

title: Governors must act as true guides and philosophers to States: CJI
content: Governors must not act as adversaries, must deal with State Bills ‘as soon as possible’ and not ‘as soon as convenient’, says Kerala; notes that only Governors of Opposition-ruled States delay assent for Bills

title: Bengaluru metro’s Red Line project faces cost reassessment before Centre’s nod
content: According to BMRCL, the line is projected to be the most expensive in Namma Metro’s history, with an estimated cost of ₹28,405 crore amounting to around ₹776.3 crore per km

title: Expert team to suggest way forward for visually impaired PT-5
content: Expert team to submit report soon outlining the best course of action to safeguard PT-5 as well as the local communities whose crops are frequently raided by the tusker.

title: Andhra Pradesh government notifies Mangalagiri Gold Cluster Land Pooling Scheme
content: The 78-acre project in Guntur district to feature a jewellery hub, luxury mall, skill centre, and housing facilities, aiming to position the State as a global jewellery destination

title: Nepal unrest: Why not banning TikTok hastened PM Oli’s resignation
content: Mass protests erupted in Nepal following a brief social media ban, excluding TikTok, leading to violence and the Prime Minister's resignation. TikTok's exemption, despite a previous ban, is attributed to its political influence among youth advocating for a Hindu state and monarchy.

title: iPhone Air, iPhone 17, Pro & Pro Max launched: India price, specs; all details
content: Apple unveiled its 2025 iPhone lineup, featuring the iPhone Air, iPhone 17, and Pro models. All boast 120Hz displays and 48MP Fusion cameras. The iPhone Air stands out as the thinnest model, while Pro versions see the return of aluminum frames. Pre-orders and India pricing were also announced.

title: Gen Z protests: Is Nepal unrest organic or ‘deep state’ regime change? Decoding Oli's ouster
content: In 1971, Gil Scott-Heron warned that “the revolution will not be televised.” In Nepal, 54 years later, the revolution didn’t need to be. It was o social media, streamed, hashtagged, and VPN-routed. And when the government tried to ban the feed, Gen Z showed that revolt finds its own broadcast – with or without television, with or without permission.

title: VP election: CP Radhakrishnan hails win as triumph of 'nationalistic ideology'
content: CP Radhakrishnan, NDA's candidate, was elected as India's 15th Vice President, securing 452 votes. He attributed his victory to the triumph of "nationalistic ideology," emphasising the importance of development over politics. Prime Minister Modi congratulated Radhakrishnan, acknowledging his extensive public service and anticipating his significant contribution to the nation's advancement.

title: With iPhone 17 series, iPhone price in India crosses Rs 2 lakh
content: Apple has launched the iPhone 17 series in India. The iPhone 17 Pro Max 2TB costs Rs 2,29,900. The phones come in deep blue, cosmic orange, and silver. The iPhone 17 Pro has a starting price of Rs 134,900. The new phones have better displays and the A19 Pro chip. The camera system includes three 48MP Fusion cameras.

title: Asian Cup Qualifiers: Blasts in Doha; India U23 crush Brunei 6-0 amid security fears
content: India's U23 football team triumphed over Brunei 6-0 in the AFC U23 Asian Cup Qualifiers, led by Vibin Mohanan's hat-trick. Despite the victory and finishing with six points, qualification hinges on other match results. Celebrations were muted amidst reports of explosions in Doha, allegedly targeting Hamas leaders by Israeli forces.

title: Cross-voting in VP election? Radhakrishnan's victory margin puts question mark on oppn's unity
content: C P Radhakrishnan of the NDA secured victory as the 15th Vice-President of India, garnering 452 votes against B Sudershan Reddy's 300. The election saw 767 MPs participating, with some cross-voting favouring Radhakrishnan. While the BJP celebrated the win and questioned opposition unity, Congress defended their performance, citing an increased vote share compared to the previous election.

title: AFG vs HK, Asia Cup: Atal, Omarzai shine; Afghanistan kick off with 94-run win
content: Afghanistan started their Asia Cup campaign strongly, defeating Hong Kong by 94 runs. Sediqullah Atal's unbeaten 73 and Azmatullah Omarzai's quickfire 53 propelled Afghanistan to 188/6. Hong Kong's chase crumbled under the pressure of Afghanistan's disciplined bowling attack, led by Fazalhaq Farooqi and Gulbadin Naib, ultimately restricting them to just 94/9.

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
content: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: Ericsson job cuts in Canada: Around 100 employees impacted; staff notified
content: Swedish telecom giant Ericsson is cutting around 100 technical jobs in Canada, according to reports. The move, announced on September 8th with an effective date of October 31st, is part of a global streamlining effort. Ericsson aims to align its Canadian network management services with worldwide operations, utilizing common tools and processes.

title: Asia Cup: New Record! Omarzai becomes fastest batter to achieve rare feat
content: Azmatullah Omarzai's explosive fifty off just 20 balls propelled Afghanistan to a formidable total against Hong Kong in their Asia Cup opener. Omarzai's record-breaking innings, surpassing Mohammad Nabi's previous best, helped Afghanistan score 78 runs in the final five overs. Poor fielding from Hong Kong, including multiple dropped catches, further aided Afghanistan's late-innings surge.

title: ‘Phillies Karen’ identified, fired after taking Bader HR ball from kid
content: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Draisaitl’s wife Celeste Desjardins shares bond with Mikayla Nurse
content: Behind the success of Edmonton Oilers stars Leon Draisaitl and Darnell Nurse. there is a friendship. A bond between their partners, Celeste Desjardins and Mikayla Nurse. The two women often show support for each other, and Celeste’s heartfelt Instagram post for Mikayla’s 30th birthday gave fans another glimpse of their strong connection beyond the ice and the NHL spotlight.

title: Who is Keeta Vaccaro? Tyreek Hill’s estranged wife; abuse claims in divorce
content: Tyreek Hill, the Miami Dolphins' wide receiver, faces serious allegations from his estranged wife, Keeta Vaccaro, who claims he was physically abusive during their 17-month marriage. Vaccaro alleges violent incidents, including one at an Orlando hotel, prompting her to file for divorce in April 2025. Hill's legal team denies these accusations amidst ongoing legal proceedings.

title: Hilarious! Chess fan asks American GM his name after photo - Watch
content: Hans Niemann, amid the FIDE Grand Swiss, experienced an unexpected viral moment when a young fan, after taking a picture, asked for his name, creating a humorous and awkward encounter. The incident amused the chess community. Niemann's tournament performance has been varied, including draws and a recent victory, maintaining his status as a closely watched player.

title: SA20 Auction: Dewald Brevis breaks all records; Sourav Ganguly calls him a 'game-changer'
content: Dewald Brevis has become the costliest player in SA20 history after Pretoria Capitals, guided by Sourav Ganguly, acquired him for a record R16.5 million. The intense bidding war saw off competition from Joburg Super Kings. Ganguly emphasized Brevis's exceptional talent, particularly his ability to play spin, justifying the high price.

title: How will Tesla reach $8.5 trillion valuation? Elon Musk’s tn dollar pay on cards
content: Elon Musk's ambitious pay package hinges on Tesla reaching an $8.5 trillion valuation within a decade, requiring an eightfold increase. This target relies heavily on the success of Optimus robots and a vast robotaxi network, potentially generating substantial revenue. Investor faith and overcoming operational hurdles, such as declining sales, will be crucial for achieving these milestones.

title: India-EU FTA: Negotiations progressing well; over 60% chapters finalised says Goyal
content: Negotiations between India and the European Union for a Free Trade Agreement are progressing positively, with approximately 60% of the chapters already finalized. EU Commissioners are scheduled to visit New Delhi in September to accelerate discussions. Germany has pledged its support to encourage the European Commission to finalize the FTA, aiming to strengthen economic ties between the EU and India.

title: 'Trump gave green light': Blasts in Doha; Israel confirms strike on Hamas leaders
content: Explosions rocked Doha, Qatar, on Tuesday, with smoke reported over the Katara district, according to Israeli media citing government officials. Israeli forces claimed responsibility, stating they targeted senior Hamas officials involved in orchestrating attacks against Israel, including the October 7 events. Al Jazeera reported the Hamas negotiation delegation was targeted during a meeting.

title: Shocking! Ind vs Pak Asia Cup tickets still not sold out
content: Dubai is gearing up for the Asia Cup 2025, but surprisingly, tickets for the highly anticipated India vs. Pakistan match on September 14 are still available, despite exorbitant prices reaching over Rs 2.5 lakh for two seats. The captains' press conference saw India's Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha kept apart, setting the stage for the intense rivalry.

title: Red sea undersea cables cut: What damaged submarine cables & impacted internet?
content: Internet services faced disruptions across Africa, Asia, and the Middle East due to damaged undersea cables in the Red Sea. Experts suspect commercial shipping activity, specifically dragging anchors, as the likely cause. The incident affected connectivity in at least 10 countries, highlighting the vulnerability of critical global communication infrastructure in a congested and strategic waterway.

title: Drinking green tea may help combat Alzheimer’s – but with an added ingredient
content: Research indicates that combining green tea's antioxidant, EGCG, with nicotinamide (vitamin B3) may rejuvenate aging brain cells and help clear harmful protein buildup linked to Alzheimer's. Lab studies reveal this pairing restores energy in neurons, boosting their ability to clear amyloid-beta plaques. Regular green tea consumption is associated with sharper memory and lower dementia risk.

title: ITR filing FY25: What is the deadline & will it be extended? Know penalty for late filing
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department has extended the ITR filing deadline for AY 2025-26 to September 15, 2025, for non-audit taxpayers. This extension, from the usual July 31st, accommodates changes in ITR forms. Taxpayers are advised to file before the deadline to avoid penalties, including late fees up to Rs 5,000 and a 1% monthly interest on outstanding taxes.

title: Avalanche strikes Siachen base camp in Ladakh; 3 soldiers killed
content: Tragedy struck the Siachen sector in Ladakh as an avalanche claimed the lives of three Indian Army personnel at a base camp. Siachen, notorious for its extreme weather and high altitude of over 18,000 feet, presents formidable challenges for military deployments.

title: Asia Cup opening ceremony: Is it happening?
content: Asia Cup is back, with India starting its title defence against UAE. An opening ceremony is unlikely. India face Pakistan on Sunday. Shubman Gill returns, creating competition. Jasprit Bumrah leads the bowling attack. The tournament serves as preparation for the upcoming Twenty20 World Cup. All eyes are on the marquee clash between India and Pakistan.

title: Jake Elliott vs Phillies Karen: Viral rumor sparks fake family drama; Eagles kicker reacts
content: A false rumor spread online claiming Philadelphia Eagles kicker Jake Elliott is the uncle of Lincoln Feltwell, the boy involved in the "Phillies Karen" incident. This claim, which surfaced after a Phillies game in August 2024, included a fabricated quote attributed to Elliott. However, no evidence supports any connection between Elliott and the Feltwell family.

title: US halts EB-1 till Oct 2025; EB-2 stays frozen: What Indian applicants must know
content: The US has halted EB-1 green card issuances until October 1, 2025, after reaching the annual cap for fiscal year 2025. This follows a similar freeze in the EB-2 category. Indian applicants face continued delays, with the EB-1 final action date stuck at February 15, 2022. No EB-1 or EB-2 approvals will be made until the new fiscal year begins. Adjustment of status applications may still be filed if priority dates remain current.

title: Asia Cup: Backstage video of PCB chair Naqvi with Suryakumar surfaces - Watch
content: A video of Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi warmly greeting India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav ahead of the Asia Cup 2025 has gone viral, adding buzz to the India-Pakistan rivalry. Despite political tensions and Naqvi's recent remarks about India, cricket took center stage as captains discussed their ambitions for the tournament, which begins today with Afghanistan facing Hong Kong.

title: Humans' maximum lifespan: Scientists say, impossible beyond 150 years
content: Research indicates a potential human lifespan limit between 120 and 150 years, regardless of lifestyle. A study in Nature Communications reveals that the body's resilience declines with age, impacting recovery from illnesses. Analyzing blood cell counts and physical activity, scientists found a point where the body can no longer fully recover, suggesting a biological ceiling on longevity.

title: Watch: PM Modi conducts aerial survey in flood-hit Himachal; to visit Punjab next
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi surveyed flood-ravaged areas in Himachal Pradesh, including Mandi and Kullu, following heavy monsoon rains. He then proceeded to Punjab for a similar assessment. Review meetings were held with officials and affected residents in both states, addressing the devastation and coordinating relief efforts. The floods have caused significant fatalities and displacement in both regions.

title: JJ McCarthy: $2 mn net worth; Vikings deal & salary; endorsements 2025
content: J.J. McCarthy, the Minnesota Vikings' quarterback, boasts a $2 million net worth in 2025, primarily from his NFL contract and endorsements. After a setback due to injury in 2024, McCarthy is now starting for the Vikings, showcasing his talent and leadership. His financial success is expected to grow with future contracts and brand deals as his career progresses.

title: US firm signs $500 mn deal with Pakistan; eyes gold, antimony, rare earth and more
content: US Strategic Metals has signed a $500 million investment deal with Pakistan to develop its mineral sector, focusing on critical minerals. This agreement, along with another with Mota-Engil Group, aims to boost mineral processing and large-scale mining projects in Pakistan. The US embassy hailed the deal as a sign of strengthened US-Pakistan relations.

title: All-time Indian greats: Ex-cricketer stirs debate; says 'Rohit does not quite make it'
content: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar ignited a debate by stating that Rohit Sharma, despite his ODI achievements and leadership, doesn't quite reach the level of Indian batting legends like Gavaskar, Tendulkar, Dravid, and Kohli. Manjrekar emphasised Test cricket's significance in defining greatness, suggesting Rohit's impact in that format was not substantial enough.

title: How Missouri's pair of five-star recruits fit, plus more 2026 commitment breakdowns
content: a total of 18 five-stars are atop the ESPN 100 player rankings for the men's college basketball class of 2026 . three are off the board as of early September . most recently, no. 12 JaShawn Andrews was the first of this group, announcing his commitment to Arkansas .

title: What to know about all 32 playcallers in the NFL: We have key trends to watch for every team
content: the 2025 season is underway, which means we got our first look at new playcallers such as the Detroit Lions ' John Morton, Tampa Bay Buccaneers ' Josh Grizzard and the Super Bowl champion Philadelphia Eagles' each of them will carry the dual responsibility of coaching and calling offensive plays .

title: Power Rankings: How did each Top 25 team look in Week 2?
content: the limited sample size highlighted some possible concerns for contenders . LSU , Penn State and Georgia had a hard time pulling away from inferior competition in Week 2 . a last-minute defensive breakdown doomed the defending Big 12 champs against Mississippi State .

title: From top prospect to fringe player, Kobbie Mainoo in limbo at Manchester United
content: Kobbie Mainoo isn't one for big outbursts of emotion, so much so that when he waved his arms to pump up the crowd, he got a bit of light teasing from his teammates in the dressing room afterwards . his decision to ask for a loan move in the final days of the transfer window was not taken lightly .

title: What happened to Oklahoma State? Is USF the team to watch?
content: the ACC and Big Ten show they have multiple teams in contention for the college football playoff . south Florida beat yet another AP Top 25 team and Oklahoma State suffered its biggest loss in over 100 years . our college football experts break down key takeaways from Week 2 performances .

title: Fantasy reaction: Bigsby trade a boon to Etienne's fantasy value
content: the fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . a big spike in Jacory Croskey-Merritt's start rate after his nice performance in Week 1 . Travis Etienne Jr. is the biggest winner here after leading the team .

title: MMA divisional rankings: How much did Nassourdine Imavov rise at middleweight?
content: Nassourdine Imavov beats caio Borralho in the uFC Fight Night main event . he moves up to no. 3 in the latest ESPN middleweight rankings . the other weight class in which rankings change is heavyweight, where Marcin Tybura drops out of the top 10 .
